item.title: Study Week May 29 – June 4
item.description:
🎤 Week 5: Presentation and Communication Skills

This week focused on how to effectively communicate ideas. We practiced creating visually clean and logical presentations and worked on public speaking skills.
We prepared slide decks on academic project topics and presented them to each other.

🗣 We also practiced the “elevator pitch” technique — summarizing a project in just 30 seconds.
✨ A valuable skill: the ability to highlight the main point and present it with confidence.

🎯 Week’s takeaway: a great presentation isn’t just about the slides — it’s about the energy behind your words.

item.title: Study Week May 22–28
item.description:
🐍 Week 4: Writing the First Python Program

This week we began exploring the Python programming language. We wrote our first scripts, solved problems using conditionals, loops, and lists,
and learned how to automate working with text and spreadsheets.

In practice, we built a mini calculator and a simple CSV data analyzer.
🔥 The most exciting part: a project that counts word frequency in a text.

💡 Realization of the week: programming isn’t hard if you break problems down into small steps.

item.title: Study Week May 15–21
item.description:
📋 Week 3: Fundamentals of Project Management

This week we explored the core principles of project management: the project life cycle, participant roles, goals, and risk assessment.
We reviewed IT case studies, discussed Agile vs. Waterfall approaches, and built a Gantt chart for a hypothetical startup.

🗂 During the seminar, we worked in teams to simulate launching an online store — assigning roles, setting deadlines, and identifying risks.
🔍 Lesson of the week: even the best idea can fail without a solid plan.

item.title: Study Week May 8–14
item.description:
🗃 Week 2: Diving into SQL

This week we started learning SQL — the language used for querying databases. We covered essential operators: SELECT, WHERE, ORDER BY, GROUP BY, and JOIN.

In the lab, we wrote queries for a sample customer and orders database. It was especially interesting to filter data using conditions and combine tables with joins.

💪 Task of the week: find all customers who placed orders worth more than 5,000 rubles.
🧠 Insight of the week: SQL is a powerful tool, and writing queries feels like composing logical expressions.

item.title: Study Week May 1–7
item.description:
📚 Week 1: First Steps in Data Analysis

This week we began exploring the basics of data analysis. We learned how to work with spreadsheets in Excel, how to build charts, and how to use functions like VLOOKUP, IF, and pivot tables.
During the practical sessions, we also tried simple data visualizations in Google Sheets and analyzed a small retail sales dataset.

✨ Highlight of the week: we explored a case study on detecting anomalies in retail reports.
📌 Takeaway: data is not just numbers — it’s the foundation for decision-making.
